io.spine.base

Class Time

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.base.Time

  • public final class Time
extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities for working with time information.

    • Method Detail

      • currentTime

        public static com.google.protobuf.Timestamp currentTime()
        Obtains current time via the current Time.Provider.
        Returns:
        current time
        See Also:
        setProvider(Provider)

      • systemTime

        public static com.google.protobuf.Timestamp systemTime()
        Obtains system time.

        The values returned are guaranteed to be different for the consecutive calls in scope of a single JVM. This is achieved by incrementing the default system time millis by the emulated nanosecond value.

        The nanoseconds are computed in a thread-safe incremental way starting at zero and ending by 999 999, leaving the millisecond value intact.

        Unlike currentTime(), this method always relies on the system milliseconds.

        Returns:
        current system time

      • currentTimeZone

        public static java.time.ZoneId currentTimeZone()
        Obtains the current time zone ID.
        Returns:
        the ZoneId of the current time zone

      • setProvider

        @Internal
public static void setProvider(Time.Provider provider)
        Sets provider of the current time.

        The most common scenario for using this method is test cases of code that deals with current time.

        Parameters:
        provider - the provider to set

      • resetProvider

        public static void resetProvider()
        Sets the default current time provider that obtains current time based on the system millis and the emulated nanosecond value.
        See Also:
        for more details
